intro: Eremalche parryi subsp. kernensis, commonly known as Kern's eremalche, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in late spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features include a branched stem and small, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
